revised_title: Invariance Properties of Stress in Plane Elasticity and Composite Materials
tldr: The authors explore the invariance of the stress field in two-dimensional elasticity and its implications for composite materials. They demonstrate that the effective compliance tensor of a composite material remains unchanged when the constituent moduli are shifted uniformly. This property explains why the effective Young's modulus of a two-dimensional medium with holes does not depend on the Poisson's ratio of the matrix material.
